page.title: 13LANDSCAPE/ECOLOGY:SWANSEA W.
page.content: In our area, there are sandstones, shales and some coal seams. Shales and coals are soft & form "flat benches". At the tops of the slopes, we have rough grazing & quarries. Some small areas of farmland are used as unofficial rubbish dumps, but most farmland is unspoilt and animals such as foxes & hares are common. Many parts of the area have families of magpies and a pair of buzzards is often seen. An increase in the amount of allotment land has curbed the activities of rabbits and hares during the day. Cwm-llwyd Reserve features deciduous woods,ferns,marshland and grazing land.There are many grasses and wild flowers, such as sea-couch,false oat, purple moor grass and brown knapweed.
